medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The abdominal pain started 2 days prior to presentation, initially diffuse and mostly periumbilical. It gradually became more focal to the right lower quadrant over the two-day period. The patient denies associated fevers, chills, nausea, vomiting, or change in bowel movements.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Hodgkin's lymphoma s/p radiation, splenectomy, hypothyroidism, mitral valve insufficiency, small bowel obstruction s/p exploratory laparotomy.
medical_history.family_history: Sister died from Hodgkin's lymphoma and leukemia.
